summary: This document contains official correspondence from the U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Justice to Jeffrey Epstein, notifying him of strict new travel reporting requirements as a registered sex offender. It also includes a response from Moroccan authorities confirming Epstein's travel to Morocco in April 2019. The document shows authorities tightening restrictions on Epstein's international travel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered sex offender subject to travel restrictions
persons.context: The primary subject of the Virgin Islands Department of Justice's travel notification requirements and the individual whose travel to Morocco is confirmed by Moroccan authorities.

events.title: USVI DOJ issues strict travel notification requirements to Epstein
events.description: The United States Virgin Islands Department of Justice sends a formal letter to Jeffrey Epstein outlining new, stricter conditions for reporting his travel as a registered sex offender, revoking previous provisions.

events.title: Epstein travels to Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein enters and exits Morocco via Marrakech-Menara Airport, as confirmed by Moroccan authorities in response to a U.S. inquiry.

events.title: Moroccan authorities confirm Epstein's travel
events.description: The Moroccan General Directorate for National Security responds to a U.S. consular request, confirming Jeffrey Epstein's border crossings into and out of Morocco on April 25, 2019.

locations: St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348 (6100 Red Hook, Suite B3)
keyFacts: On March 14, 2019, the U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Justice revoked previous travel notification provisions for Jeffrey Epstein and imposed stricter in-person reporting requirements for any travel outside the territory.
Epstein was required to appear in person at least 21 days before any international travel and provide detailed itinerary information, with potential prosecution for failure to comply.
Moroccan authorities confirmed that Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Morocco on April 25, 2019, entering and exiting via Marrakech-Menara Airport using passport #566672615.
The document references Epstein's status on the "American registry of sexual delinquents" and the application of both Virgin Islands Code and federal law (18 U.S.C. Section 2250) for enforcement.
The correspondence indicates international law enforcement cooperation, with U.S. authorities requesting and receiving information from Moroccan security services about Epstein's travel.
